contentrichtext.text: '''UniSoft Corporation''' is a former [[Unix]] vendor that now works on software for [[digital television]] development and broadcast. == History == '''UniSoft''' was founded in 1981, initially working as a [[Unix]] porting house, completing over 225 Unix ports to numerous [[Central processing unit|CPU]] [[architecture]]s. Its port of [[Version 7 Unix]] was the operating system for the [[Sun-1|first]] [[Sun Microsystems|Sun Microsystems']] [[Sun-1|workstations]]. It got into the digital TV industry in 1997 due to the lack of standards compliant software in the industry. It now focuses solely on development, testing, and broadcast tools for digital TV.<ref>[http://www.unisoft.com/history.html The Unisoft's Brief History] from the [http://www.unisoft.com/ Unisoft's website], Retrieved 2009-05-25</ref> == See also== * [[Callan Data Systems]] * [[Uniplus+]] * [[Unix-like]] == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Defunct software companies]] [[Category:A/UX]] [[Category:Companies established in 1981]] {{ict-company-stub}}
